name: iambic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to refer to a rhythm (= pattern of words) used in poetry, in which each short syllable that is not stressed is followed by a long or stressed syllable: iambic pentameter Most of Shakespeare's verse is written in iambic pentameter (= rhythm with each line made of five iambic pairs). Compare
dactylic
spondaic
trochaic
